intro:
Select a dataset to explore for this intro.

Selection required for tour.

Click to show inputs to upload custom query signature.

The uploaded file must contain two named columns with:

1: unique HGNC gene symbols in first column.

2: effect size values in second column or a column named dprime or logFC.

For a bulk dataset select a test group then a control group.

For a single-cell dataset select a cluster. Test and control groups are defined during integration.

Selection required for tour.

Standardized effect sizes for the query genes - the top 200 differentially expressed genes

Details of standardized effect sizes – think limma t-statistics in units of standard deviation.

Select perturbation database to query against.

CMAP02:
1309 drugs with ~14,500 genes assayed across 3 tumor cell lines.

L1000:
~20,000 compounds and 7,000 genetic perturbations with 978 genes assayed across 70 cell lines.
Click to restrict query results to compounds with a clinical phase.

Click to show inputs to:

a. restrict results to specific cell lines.
b. sort results by average across signatures for each perturbation.
c. restrict results to perturbagens with a minimum number of signatures.

Perturbation signatures are sorted by their pearson correlation to the query signature.

For drugs, negatively correlated signatures show up first as they best reverse the query signature.

Hint: Hover over points in the Correlation column to see the cell line, dose, duration, and number of treated samples for a signature (separated by underscores).
Select a perturbation to show the combined effect of the query signature and the perturbation signature.
